sen.j: 常盤井宮全明親王（ときわいのみやまたあきらしんのう、永享11年（1439年） - 大永元年12月7日 (旧暦)（1522年1月4日））は室町時代の皇族。
sen.e: Imperial Prince Tokiwanomiya Mataakira (1439 - January 4, 1522) was a member of the Imperial family in the Muromachi period.
Imperial Prince Tokiwanomiya Mataakira (1439 - January 4, 1522) was a member of the Imperial family during the Muromachi period.
Imperial Prince Tokiwainomiya Mataakira (1439 - January 14, 1522) was a member of the Imperial family during the Muromachi period.
sen.cmt: Tokiwainomiyaスペル訂正しました。"January 4"→"January 14 "に変更しました。

sen.e: He was the 5th head of the Tokiwanomiya family.
He was the 5th head of the Tokiwanomiya family.
He was the 5th head of the Tokiwainomiya family.

sen.j: 4代・常盤井宮直明王の子で、兄弟に勧修寺に入った恒弘法親王がいる。
sen.e: He was a son of Prince Tokiwainomiya Naohito, the 4th head, and monk-Imperial Prince Goko, who entered Kaju-ji Temple, was his brother.
He was a son of Prince Tokiwainomiya Naohito, the 4th head, and monk-Imperial Prince Goko, who entered Kaju-ji Temple, was his brother.
He was a son of Prince Tokiwainomiya Naohito, the 4th head, and the Cloistered Imperial Prince Goko, who entered Kaju-ji Temple, was his brother.
sen.cmt: 法親王→Cloistered Imperial Prince に訂正しました。

sen.j: 伏見宮貞成親王の猶子となり、永享11年4月に親王宣下を受け、3年後の嘉吉2年（1442年）には弾正尹に補任された（『砂巖』）。
sen.e: He was adopted by Imperial Prince Fushiminomiya Sadafusa, and in April 1439, he was given the title of Imperial Prince, and three years later, in 1442, he was appointed as Danjoin (President of the Board of Censors) ("Sagan"(sandstone)).

He was adopted by Imperial Prince Fushiminomiya Sadafusa, and in April 1439, he was given the title of Imperial Prince, and three years later, in 1442, he was appointed as Danjoin (President of the Board of Censors) ("Sagan"- sandstone).

He was adopted by Imperial Prince Fushiminomiya Sadafusa, and in May 1439, he was given the title of Imperial Prince, and three years later, in 1442, he was appointed as Danjoin (President of the Board of Censors) ("Sagan"- sandstone).

sen.j: この時代には珍しく長命を保ち、大永元年に83歳で薨去した。
sen.e: It was rare at the time, but he lived long and died in 1521 at the age of 83. His life was tossed about by political confusion, and was an unhappy one; for example, Tokiwai dono (mansion), his ancestral home, was burned down by war fire in June 1467.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It was rare at the time, but he lived long and died in 1521 at the age of 83. His life was tossed about by political confusion, and was an unhappy one; for example, Tokiwai dono (mansion), his ancestral home, was burned down in war during June 1467.
It was rare at the time, but he lived long and died in 1521 at the age of 83.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処

sen.j: が、先祖伝来の館・常盤井殿が応仁元年（1467年）6月に兵火にあい全焼するなど、政治の混乱に翻弄され、不遇な生涯であった。
sen.e: His life was tossed about by political confusion, and was an unhappy one; for example, Tokiwai dono (mansion), his ancestral home, was burned down in war during July 1467.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処"June"→"July "に変更しました。
